Patent Information.Abstract: Methods of modulating the half-life of an antimicrobial peptide are described. The method may include administering an antimicrobial peptide to an environment where the antimicrobial peptide remains active until a specified endpoint, and on or after the specified endpoint, digesting the antimicrobial peptide with a protease to thereby inactivate the antimicrobial peptide and modulate its half-life. Compositions and kits for modulating the half-life of an antimicrobial peptide are also described.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: X. oryzae pv oryzae, R. solanacearum.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The solution structure of LCI has a novel topology, containing a four-strand antiparallel beta-sheet as the dominant secondary structure.
Sequence Information.Function: Has antibacterial activity against X.oryzae pv oryzae and R.solanacearum. May bind DNA or mRNA.
Sequence Information.Miscellaneous: Heat stable. Resistant to proteolysis by tryspin and pepsin, but susceptible to pronase E and proteinase K.

Literature.Title: Characterization of an anti-rice bacterial blight polypeptide LCI.
Literature.Author: Liu JY, Pan NS, Chen ZL.

Literature.Title: Solution structure of LCI, an AMP from Bacillus subtilis.
Literature.Author: Xia, B, Gong, W, Lu, G.
